Package com.pump.image.transition

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Transition
    This renders a transition between two images.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractClippedTransition2D
    This transition merges several shapes, and simply shows the incoming image as clipped through that collective area.
    AbstractPlanarTransition2D
    Here 2 frames slide around on an imaginary table top extending into the distance.
    AbstractShapeTransition2D
    This takes any abstract silhouette and will zoom it in/out to reveal the new frame.
    AbstractTransition
    This abstract class handles bounds checking.
    BarsTransition2D
    This is a series of random bars that increase in frequency, slowly revealing the new frame.
    BlendTransition2D
    Also know as the "Fade" transition, this simply fades in the opacity of the incoming frame.
    BlindsTransition2D
    Also known as "Venetian Blinds", this creates several horizontal/vertical strips that grow in width/height respectively to reveal the new frame.
    BoxTransition2D
    This clips to the shape of a square zooming in/out.
    CheckerboardTransition2D
    This creates a checkerboard pattern that grows to reveal the new frame.
    CircleTransition2D
    This clips to the shape of a circle zooming in/out.
    CollapseTransition2D
    In this transition the original image is split into 6 horizontal strips, and they collapse downward to reveal the next image underneath.
    CubeTransition3D
    This transition rotates a cube 90 degrees to reveal the next image.
    CurtainTransition2D
    This splits a frame down the middle and squishes the two left and right halves, as if a curtain is being opened.
    DiamondsTransition2D
    This creates a pattern of growing diamonds.
    DocumentaryTransition2D
    This is a combination of zooming and panning.
    DotsTransition2D
    This is a playful series of dots bubbling up from nowhere to produce the incoming image.
    DropTransition2D
    This is basically a "slide down" transition, but with a bounce at the bottom.
    FlipTransition3D
    This transition flips the viewing surface over 180 degrees to reveal the inverted back.
    FlurryTransition2D
    In this transition one image breaks into several smaller tiles and then is whisked away as if by a wind.
    FunkyWipeTransition2D
    This is a fun variation of a "Wipe" transition.
    GooTransition2D
    This resembles a bucket of paint being thrown at a wall.
    HalftoneTransition2D
    In this transition an image splits apart into several tiny circles that shrink in size.
    ImageInstruction
    This is an instruction to render an image.
    KaleidoscopeTransition2D
    This resembles looking through a kaleidoscope.
    LevitateTransition2D
    This breaks the existing image into 6 horizontal strips, and then (after a gently wobbly start) that levitate/accelerate up and out of the frame, revealing the next image.
    MeshShuffleTransition2D
    The concept here was to resemble a deck of cards being shuffled.
    MicroscopeTransition2D
    This transition "zooms in" on the existing image into the incoming image comes into view.
    MirageTransition2D
    In a square-ish way, this resembles an image coming into focus like a mirage in a desert.
    MotionBlendTransition2D
    This is a blend transition with a subtle zoom in/out added.
    PivotTransition2D
    This pivots a frame in/out from a specific corner, as if there is a hinge involved.
    PushTransition2D
    This is the standard "push" transition.
    RadialWipeTransition2D
    This uses clipping to sweep out a circular path, revealing the new frame.
    RefractiveTransition2D
    This resembles a lens with several faces, showing several fractured copies of the same image.
    RevealTransition2D
    This takes the current frame and slides it away to reveal the new frame underneath.
    ReversedTransition
    A Transition that plays another transition in reverse.
    RotateTransition2D
    This spins one frame in/out from the center.
    ScaleTransition2D
    This zooms one frame in/out from the center.
    ScribbleTransition2D
    This reveals the next frame as if a giant eraser is scribbling away the current frame.
    ShapeInstruction
    This instruction is used to render a shape.
    SlideTransition2D
    This is the standard "slide" transition.
    SpiralTransition2D
    In this transition a wobbling spiral grows to fill the entire frame; inside the shape is the incoming image.
    SplitTransition2D
    This splits the frame either horizontally or vertically.
    SquareRainTransition2D
    In this transition geometric shapes (squares and circles) trickle downwards revealing the next frame.
    SquaresTransition2D
    In this transition the current frame splits off into several tiles that calmly "explode" towards the viewer, revealing the next frame underneath.
    StarsTransition2D
    In this transition the current frame splits apart into shrinking stars that spin off towards a distant point.
    StarTransition2D
    This clips to the shape of a star zooming in/out.
    SwivelTransition2D
    This transition resembles two still images on a turntable.
    TossTransition2D
    In this transition the incoming frame is tossed into place, and after a little bit of wobbling it settles down.
    Transition2D
    This uses Java2D operations to transition between two images.
    Transition2DInstruction
    This represents one "layer" of a frame of a transition.
    Transition3D
    This provides a few static tools to help make 3D transitions.
    Transition3D.BasicProjection  
    Transition3D.Point3D  
    Transition3D.Point3D.Double  
    WaveTransition2D
    This slides the incoming frame in a wavy motion, similar to a flag whipping in the wind.
    WeaveTransition2D
    This paints the incoming frame in thin horizontal strips that slide into place.
    WipeTransition2D
    This is the standard "wipe" transition.
    ZoomTransition2D
    In this 3D-ish transition the 2 frames slide forward, as if the viewer is at the end of a conveyer belt.
